intro: Cupaniopsis phalacrocarpa, commonly known as the blackwood or blackwood tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dark, almost black, bark and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
